<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2><a name="toc6"></a>1.4&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Schedules and Exhibits</font></u><font size=2>.  This Agreement consists of the Articles contained herein and the Schedules and Exhibits attached hereto, all of which comprise part of one and the same agreement with equal force and effect.</font></p>

<p STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;'><B><FONT SIZE=2>ARTICLE II</FONT></B></P>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><b><font size=2><a name="toc7"></a>PURCHASE AND SALE OF MEMBERSHIP INTEREST</font></b></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2><a name="toc8"></a>2.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Sale and Transfer of the Membership Interest</font></u><font size=2>.  Upon the terms and subject to the conditions contained herein, on the Closing Date, the Seller shall sell, assign, transfer, convey and deliver to the Purchaser, and the Purchaser shall purchase from the Seller, the Membership Interest, free and clear of all Encumbrances, except for any Encumbrances imposed pursuant to Applicable Law or this Agreement.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2><a name="toc9"></a>2.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Purchase Price.</font></u><font size=2>  The aggregate purchase price for the Membership Interest shall be an amount equal to three hundred twenty-five million U.S. dollars ($325,000,000.00) (the &#147;</font><u><font size=2>Purchase Price</font></u><font size=2>&#148;) as the same may be adjusted if and as required pursuant to the provisions of </font><u><font size=2>Sections 2.5</font></u><font size=2> and </font><u><font size=2>2.6</font></u><font size=2>.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2><a name="toc10"></a>2.3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Payment of Purchase Price</font></u><font size=2>.  The Purchaser shall transfer the Purchase Price if and as adjusted pursuant to </font><u><font size=2>Section 2.5</font></u><font size=2> to the Seller at the Closing.  Adjustments, if any, pursuant to </font><u><font size=2>Sections 2.5</font></u><font size=2> and </font><u><font size=2>2.6</font></u><font size=2> shall be paid in accordance with the provisions of such applicable Section.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2><a name="toc11"></a>2.4&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Allocation of Purchase Price; Tax Filings</font></u><font size=2>.  For federal Tax purposes and relevant state income Tax purposes, the Project Company is classified as a disregarded entity.  Consequently, the sale and purchase of the Membership Interest hereunder is to be treated as a sale and purchase of the Assets for all such purposes.  The Purchase Price, plus the amount of the Project Company&#146;s Liabilities that constitute part of the amount realized for federal income Tax purposes, shall be allocated among the Assets, which allocation shall be arrived at by an independent appraisal, conducted at the Purchaser&#146;s sole expense by Navigant Consulting or another  nationally recognized appraiser mutually agreeable to the Purchaser and the Seller, in compliance with Section 1060 of the Code and the
regulations promulgated thereunder.  The Purchaser shall provide the allocation arrived at by such independent appraisal to the Seller by July 15, 2006.  In the event that the Seller disagrees with the allocation arrived at by such independent appraisal, the Purchaser and the Seller shall jointly appoint PricewaterhouseCoopers or another independent accounting firm of international reputation mutually acceptable to the Seller and the Purchaser (the &#147;</font><u><font size=2>Independent </font></u><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="36" style='margin-left:210.0pt;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="36" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>14</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<pAGE>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><u><font size=2>Accounting Firm</font></u><font size=2>&#148;), which shall, at the Purchaser&#146;s and the Seller&#146;s equal expense, within fifteen (15) days (or such other period mutually agreed upon by the Purchaser and the Seller) determine the appropriate allocation with respect to the issues in dispute.  The finding of such Independent Accounting Firm shall be binding on the Purchaser and the Seller.  Promptly after the determination of the post-Closing Purchase Price adjustment pursuant to </font><u><font size=2>Section 2.6</font></u><font size=2>, the parties shall mutually revise the allocation to the extent necessary to reflect the Purchase Price adjustments made pursuant to </font><u><font size=2>Sections 2.5</font></u><font size=2> and </font><u><font size=2>2.6</font></u><font size=2>, and references to &#147;such allocation&#148; in this </font><u><font size=2>Section 2.4</font></u><font size=2> shall
refer to the allocation after such revision.  Each of the Purchaser and the Seller shall (i) timely file all forms (including Internal Revenue Service Form 8594) and Tax Returns required to be filed in connection with such allocation, (ii) be bound by such allocation for purposes of determining Taxes, (iii) prepare and file, and cause its Affiliates to prepare and file, its Tax Returns on a basis consistent with such allocation and (iv) take no position, and cause its Affiliates to take no position, inconsistent with such allocation on any applicable Tax Return, in any audit or proceeding before any Taxing Authority, in any report made for Tax, financial accounting or any other purposes, or otherwise.  Notwithstanding the foregoing, the parties agree that it will not be inconsistent with such allocation for (a) the Purchaser&#146;s cost for the Assets to differ from the total amount allocated hereunder to reflect capitalized acquisition costs not included in the total amount allocated
pursuant to this </font><u><font size=2>Section 2.4</font></u><font size=2> and (b) the amount realized by the Seller to differ from the total amount allocated pursuant to this </font><u><font size=2>Section 2.4</font></u><font size=2> to reflect transaction costs that reduce the amount realized for federal income Tax purposes.  In the event that the allocation pursuant to this </font><u><font size=2>Section 2.4</font></u><font size=2> is disputed by any Taxing Authority, the party receiving notice of such dispute shall promptly notify the other party hereto concerning the existence and resolution of such dispute.</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="316" style='margin-left:0pt;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="60" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2><a name="toc12"></a>2.5</font></p> </td>
        <td width="256" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Closing Purchase Price Adjustments</font></u><font size=2>.</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Fuel Oil</font></u><font size=2>.  Not less than ten (10) Business Days prior to the Closing Date, the Seller shall deliver to the Purchaser a statement of the amount of fuel oil owned by the Project Company or any Affiliate of the Project Company and held for use by the Project Company at the Facility as of a date within twenty (20) Business Days prior to the Closing Date that is certified by an authorized officer of the Seller as having been prepared in good faith (the &#147;</font><u><font size=2>Pre-Closing Fuel Oil Statement</font></u><font size=2>&#148;); </font><u><font size=2>provided</font></u><font size=2>, that for the avoidance of doubt, the Pre-Closing Fuel Oil Statement shall not include any fuel oil owned by Duke Power pursuant to the Duke Power Contracts or otherwise or any fuel oil purchased by Duke Power pursuant to the
Duke Power Contracts prior to the Closing Date.</font><b><font size=2>  </font></b><font size=2>The Pre-Closing Fuel Oil Statement shall be accompanied by such backup information and schedules as are reasonably required in order for the Purchaser to understand and verify the accuracy of the computation of the amount of fuel oil reflected on the Pre-Closing Fuel Oil Statement.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Adjustments</font></u><font size=2>.  The Purchase Price shall be adjusted upward by the product of the Rowan Oil Inventory Price multiplied by the amount of fuel oil reflected on the Pre-Closing Fuel Oil Statement.    </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2><a name="toc13"></a>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="36" style='margin-left:210.0pt;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="36" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>15</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<pAGE>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>2.6&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Post-Closing Purchase Price Adjustment</font></u><font size=2>.  The Purchase Price shall be subject to adjustment after the Closing as specified in this </font><u><font size=2>Section 2.6</font></u><font size=2>.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Closing Fuel Oil Statement</font></u><font size=2>.  As promptly as practicable, but in no event later than forty-five (45) days following the Closing Date, the Seller shall deliver to the Purchaser a statement of the amount of fuel oil owned by the Project Company at the Facility as of the Closing Date that is certified by an authorized officer of the Seller as having been prepared in good faith (the &#147;</font><u><font size=2>Seller&#146;s Closing Fuel Oil Statement</font></u><font size=2>&#148;); </font><u><font size=2>provided</font></u><font size=2>, that for the avoidance of doubt, the Seller&#146;s Closing Fuel Oil Statement shall not include any fuel oil owned by Duke Power pursuant to the Duke Power Contracts or otherwise or any fuel oil purchased by Duke Power pursuant to the Duke Power Contracts prior to the Closing
Date.</font><b><font size=2>  </font></b><font size=2>The Seller&#146;s Closing Fuel Oil Statement shall be accompanied by such backup information and schedules as are reasonably required in order for the Purchaser to understand and verify the accuracy of the computation of the amount of fuel oil reflected on the Seller&#146;s Closing Fuel Oil Statement.  The Seller&#146;s Closing Fuel Oil Statement shall be deemed final for the purposes of this </font><u><font size=2>Section 2.6(a)</font></u><font size=2> (and as and when deemed final shall be referred to as the &#147;</font><u><font size=2>Closing Fuel Oil Statement</font></u><font size=2>&#148;) upon the earlier of (A) the failure of the Purchaser to notify the Seller of a dispute within twenty (20) Business Days after the delivery of the Seller&#146;s Closing Fuel Oil Statement to the Purchaser, (B) the resolution of all disputes, pursuant to </font><u><font size=2>Section 2.6(b)(i)</font></u><font size=2>, by the Seller&#146;s
accountants and the Purchaser&#146;s accountants, and (C) the resolution of all disputes, pursuant to </font><u><font size=2>Section 2.6(b)(ii)</font></u><font size=2>, by the Independent Accounting Firm.</font><b><font size=2> </font></b></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="355" style='margin-left:1.0in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>(b)</font></p> </td>
        <td width="307" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Fuel Oil Statement Issue Resolution Process</font></u><font size=2>.</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1.25in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(i)&nbsp;The Seller may in good faith dispute any amounts reflected on the Seller&#146;s Closing Fuel Oil Statement delivered pursuant to </font><u><font size=2>Section 2.6(a)</font></u><font size=2>, to the extent that the net effect of such disputed amounts would affect the adjustment pursuant to </font><u><font size=2>Section 2.6(c)</font></u><font size=2>, but only on the basis that the amounts reflected on such statements are incorrect or were not arrived at in accordance with GAAP in a manner consistent with the Financial Statements.  The Purchaser shall deliver notice of such a dispute to the Seller setting forth in reasonable detail the items or amounts disputed and the Purchaser&#146;s proposed corrections.  In the event of such a dispute, the Seller&#146;s and the Purchaser&#146;s respective accountants shall attempt to reconcile their differences, and any resolution by them as
to any disputed amounts shall be final, binding and conclusive on the parties hereto.  If the Seller&#146;s and the Purchaser&#146;s respective accountants are unable to reach a resolution within sixty (60) days of the delivery of the Seller&#146;s Closing Fuel Oil Statement, the items remaining in dispute shall be submitted for resolution to the Independent Accounting Firm.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1.21in;text-align:left;'><font size=2> (ii)&nbsp;The Independent Accounting Firm shall, within thirty (30) days after the items remaining in dispute are submitted to the Independent Accounting Firm, or such longer period of time as the Independent Accounting Firm determines is necessary, deliver its written determination to the Seller and the Purchaser upon such items.  The Independent Accounting Firm&#146;s determination shall be final, binding and conclusive on the Seller and the Purchaser.  The fees and disbursements of the Independent Accounting Firm shall be allocated between the Seller and the Purchaser in </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="36" style='margin-left:210.0pt;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="36" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>16</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<pAGE>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>the same proportion that the aggregate amount of such remaining disputed items so submitted to the Independent Accounting Firm that is unsuccessfully disputed by each such party as finally determined by the Independent Accounting Firm bears to the total amount of such remaining disputed items.  The Purchaser and the Seller shall make readily available to the Independent Accounting Firm all relevant information, books and records and any work papers relating to the dispute and all other items reasonably requested by the Independent Accounting Firm.  In no event may the Independent Accounting Firm&#146;s resolution of any difference be for an amount which is outside the range of the Purchaser&#146;s and the Seller&#146;s disagreement.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.75in;text-align:left;'><font size=2> (c)&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Adjustment</font></u><font size=2>.  The post-Closing Purchase Price adjustment shall be an amount equal to the product of the Rowan Oil Inventory Price multiplied by the amount (positive or negative) equal to the amount of fuel oil reflected on the Closing Fuel Oil Statement minus the amount of fuel oil reflected on the Pre-Closing Fuel Oil Statement.  If the result is a positive number, then the Purchase Price shall be adjusted upward in an amount equal to the result obtained under this </font><u><font size=2>Section 2.6(c)</font></u><font size=2>, and within three (3) Business Days after the finalization of the Closing Fuel Oil Statement pursuant to </font><u><font size=2>Section 2.6(a)</font></u><font size=2>, such amount shall be paid by the Purchaser to the Seller by wire transfer in immediately available funds.  If the result obtained in this
</font><u><font size=2>Section 2.6(c)</font></u><font size=2> is a negative number, then the Purchase Price shall be adjusted downward in an amount equal to such result, and within three (3) Business Days after the finalization of the Closing Fuel Oil Statement pursuant to </font><u><font size=2>Section 2.6(a)</font></u><font size=2>, such amount shall be paid by the Seller to the Purchaser by wire transfer in immediately available funds.  </font></p>

<p STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;'><B><FONT SIZE=2>ARTICLE III</FONT></B></P>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;'><B><FONT SIZE=2><A NAME="TOC14"></A>CLOSING</FONT></B></P>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2><a name="toc15"></a>3.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Time and Place of Closing</font></u><font size=2>.  The closing of the purchase and sale of the Membership Interest (the &#147;</font><u><font size=2>Closing</font></u><font size=2>&#148;) shall take place at the offices of Troutman Sanders LLP in Atlanta, Georgia, within three (3) Business Days after the conditions to Closing set forth in </font><u><font size=2>Article VIII</font></u><font size=2> (excluding conditions that, by their terms, cannot be satisfied until the Closing) have been satisfied (or waived by the party entitled to waive such condition), but no earlier than August 31, 2006, or at such other place, date and time as the parties may agree.  The Closing shall be deemed effective as of 11:59 P.M. Atlanta, Georgia time on the Closing Date.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2><a name="toc16"></a>3.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Deliveries by the Seller</font></u><font size=2>.  At the Closing, the Seller shall deliver, or cause to be delivered, to the Purchaser:</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;an executed counterparty of the instrument conveying title to the Membership Interest substantially in the form of </font><u><font size=2>Exhibit A</font></u><font size=2>;</font></p>


<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;executed copies of the Seller Approvals;</font></p>

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2></font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;an executed officer&#146;s certificate of the Seller in the form attached hereto as </font><u><font size=2>Exhibit B</font></u><font size=2>; </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="36" style='margin-left:210.0pt;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="36" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>17</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<pAGE>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;executed secretary&#146;s certificates of the Seller and Progress Energy in the forms attached as </font><u><font size=2>Exhibit C</font></u><font size=2> and </font><u><font size=2>Exhibit D</font></u><font size=2>, respectively;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;except as set forth in </font><u><font size=2>Section 5.16</font></u><font size=2> of the </font><u><font size=2>Seller&#146;s Disclosure Schedule</font></u><font size=2>, the books, records and files of the Project Company related to the Project and to the operation and maintenance of the Project and copies of any records of Progress Ventures related to any Employee (as permitted by Applicable Law) to whom the Purchaser or one of its Affiliates has extended an offer of employment which has been accepted on or prior to the Closing Date (in lieu of any originals of any such books, records and files, the Seller may provide copies thereof provided that it identifies them as such and such books, records and files do not relate solely to the business of the Project Company); </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a release of the Project Company from all Liabilities incurred by the Project Company prior to the Closing and owing to the Seller or any of its Affiliates as of the Closing (&#147;</font><u><font size=2>Intercompany Payables</font></u><font size=2>&#148;), other than those Liabilities set forth on </font><u><font size=2>Schedule 7.8(c)</font></u><font size=2>, in the form attached as </font><u><font size=2>Exhibit E</font></u><font size=2>;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(g)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;assignment and assumption agreements substantially in the form of </font><u><font size=2>Exhibit F</font></u><font size=2>, properly executed by the Seller or its Affiliates and (i) the Project Company or (ii) the Purchaser or its Affiliates, pursuant to which all rights and obligations of the Seller or its Affiliates (A) to the fuel oil held for use by Seller or an Affiliate of Seller (other than the Project Company) for use at the Facility but not owned by the Project Company, and (B) under the agreements set forth in </font><u><font size=2>Section 3.2(g)</font></u><font size=2> of the </font><u><font size=2>Seller&#146;s Disclosure Schedule</font></u><font size=2> were assigned to, and assumed by, the Project Company, the Purchaser or an Affiliate of the Purchaser at or prior to the Closing;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(h)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;proof of the termination of, or removal of the Project Company as a party to, the agreements with the Seller or its Affiliates and other intercompany arrangements set forth in </font><u><font size=2>Section 3.2(h)</font></u><font size=2> of the </font><u><font size=2>Seller&#146;s Disclosure Schedule</font></u><font size=2>, in a form reasonably acceptable to the Purchaser;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;an assignment and assumption agreement in the form attached as </font><u><font size=2>Exhibit G</font></u><font size=2>, properly executed by the Seller, pursuant to which all Excluded Assets owned by the Project Company and all Pre-Closing Accounts Payable of the Project Company are assigned by the Project Company to, and assumed by, the Seller or an Affiliate of the Seller other than the Project Company at or prior to the Closing; </font></p>


<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(j)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a receipt for the payment of the Purchase Price;</font></p>

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2></font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(k)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;an executed certificate from an officer of the Seller in the form attached as </font><u><font size=2>Exhibit H</font></u><font size=2>, dated as of the Closing Date, that:</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;each Unit is operational, dispatchable and capable of meeting the scheduling requirements of Duke Power and NCMPA in accordance with the Duke Power Contracts and the NCMPA Contracts, respectively;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="36" style='margin-left:210.0pt;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="36" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>18</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<pAGE>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;each Unit is in compliance with all noise and emissions limitations and other material Applicable Laws and Approvals; and</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(iii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the combined cycle Unit is capable of delivering net electrical output of no less than ninety-six percent (96%) of 468 MW, and the simple cycle Units 1, 2 and 3 are collectively capable of simultaneously delivering net electrical output of no less than ninety-six percent (96%) of 453 MW; </font><u><font size=2>provided</font></u><font size=2>, that such certification shall not constitute a representation or warranty by the Seller to such net electrical output under such conditions;  </font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="440" style='margin-left:1.0in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2></font></p> </td>
        <td width="392" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2></font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(l)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;resignations from all officers of the Project Company; and</font></p>


<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(m)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;any other documents or instruments or copies thereof as may be reasonably necessary to effect or facilitate the transactions contemplated hereunder to the extent reasonably requested by the Purchaser not less than five (5) Business Days prior to the Closing.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.87in;text-align:left;'><font size=2><a name="toc17"></a>3.3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Deliveries by the Purchaser</font></u><font size=2>.  At the Closing, the Purchaser shall deliver, or cause to be delivered, to the Seller:</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;an executed counterparty of the instrument conveying title to the Membership Interest substantially in the form attached hereto as </font><u><font size=2>Exhibit A</font></u><font size=2>;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Purchase Price (less any net amounts, if any, for which Seller is liable, or plus any net amounts, if any, for which Purchaser is liable, pursuant to </font><u><font size=2>Section 9.2</font></u><font size=2>) to an account designated by the Seller in writing by wire transfer in immediately available funds;</font></p>


<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;executed copies of the Purchaser Approvals;</font></p>

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2></font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;an executed officer&#146;s certificate of the Purchaser in the form attached hereto as </font><u><font size=2>Exhibit I</font></u><font size=2>; </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;executed secretary&#146;s certificates of the Purchaser and Southern Power in the forms attached hereto as </font><u><font size=2>Exhibit J</font></u><font size=2> and </font><u><font size=2>Exhibit K</font></u><font size=2>, respectively; and</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;any other documents or instruments or copies thereof as may be reasonably necessary to effect or facilitate the transactions contemplated hereunder to the extent reasonably requested by the Seller not less than five (5) Business Days prior to the Closing.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

    <tr >
        <td width="36" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>19</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;'><B><FONT SIZE=2>ARTICLE IV</FONT></B></P>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;'><B><FONT SIZE=2><A NAME="TOC18"></A>TERMINATION</FONT></B></P>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2><a name="toc19"></a>4.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Termination of Agreement</font></u><font size=2>.  Subject to the limitations set forth in </font><u><font size=2>Section 4.2</font></u><font size=2>, this Agreement may be terminated prior to the Closing Date as follows:</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At any time prior to the Closing Date by the written consent of the Seller and the Purchaser;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="317" style='margin-left:1.0in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>(b)</font></p> </td>
        <td width="269" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>By either the Seller or the Purchaser if:</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Closing has not occurred on or before November 1, 2006 (as may be extended pursuant to a written agreement of the parties, the &#147;</font><u><font size=2>Outside Date</font></u><font size=2>&#148;); </font><u><font size=2>provided</font></u><font size=2>, </font><u><font size=2>however</font></u><font size=2>, that the terminating party is not in default of its obligations hereunder; </font><u><font size=2>provided further</font></u><font size=2>, that if following November 1, 2006 the only condition set forth in </font><u><font size=2>Article VIII</font></u><font size=2> that remains unsatisfied is a Purchaser Approval or Seller Approval required from the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, then the Outside Date shall automatically be extended to December 1, 2006, or</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;there shall be any Applicable Law that makes consummation of the transactions contemplated hereby illegal or otherwise prohibited (and such Law is not overturned or otherwise made inapplicable to the transactions contemplated hereby within a period of ninety (90) days) or if any Order is entered by a Governmental Authority of competent jurisdiction having valid enforcement authority permanently restraining, prohibiting or enjoining the Seller or the Purchaser from consummating the transactions contemplated hereby and such Order shall become final and non-appealable.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;By the Seller if the Purchaser has breached any of its representations, warranties, covenants or other agreements contained in this Agreement; </font><u><font size=2>provided</font></u><font size=2>, </font><u><font size=2>however</font></u><font size=2>, that such breach (i) cannot be or has not been cured within thirty (30) days of the Seller&#146;s written notice of such breach, and (ii) would cause the failure of any condition set forth in </font><u><font size=2>Article VIII</font></u><font size=2>.</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="181" style='margin-left:1.0in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>(d)</font></p> </td>
        <td width="133" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>By the Purchaser:</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;if the Seller has breached any of its representations, warranties, covenants or other agreements contained in this Agreement; </font><u><font size=2>provided</font></u><font size=2>, </font><u><font size=2>however</font></u><font size=2>, that such breach (A) cannot be or has not been cured within thirty (30) days of the Purchaser&#146;s written notice of such breach, and (B) would cause the failure of any condition set forth in </font><u><font size=2>Article VIII</font></u><font size=2>; </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;if a supplement or amendment to the Schedules is made pursuant to </font><u><font size=2>Section 7.10</font></u><font size=2> to cure a materially inaccurate or incomplete representation and warranty and the Purchaser has made a valid and timely written objection thereto in accordance with </font><u><font size=2>Section 7.10</font></u><font size=2>; </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="36" style='margin-left:210.0pt;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="36" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>20</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="324" style='margin-left:1.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>(iii)</font></p> </td>
        <td width="240" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>at any time prior to June 15, 2006;</font></p> </td>
        <td  width="36">
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>(iv)</font></p> </td>
        <td  colspan="2" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>if permitted pursuant to Section 7.11; or</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(v)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;if (x) the combined cycle Unit or the simple cycle Units collectively are unable to complete the performance tests contemplated by </font><u><font size=2>Section 7.15</font></u><font size=2> such that the Seller is not able to provide the certification required under </font><u><font size=2>Section 3.2(k)</font></u><font size=2>, and (y) the Seller fails to retest the combined cycle Unit or the simple cycle Units, as the case may be, which failed to meet the required performance criteria within thirty (30) days of the failed performance test or any such retest, as provided for in </font><u><font size=2>Section 7.15</font></u><font size=2>, fails to meet the required performance criteria. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2><a name="toc20"></a>4.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Effect of Termination</font></u><font size=2>.  No termination of this Agreement pursuant to </font><u><font size=2>Section 4.1</font></u><font size=2> shall be effective until written notice thereof is given in accordance with </font><u><font size=2>Section 11.10</font></u><font size=2> to the non-terminating party specifying the provision hereof pursuant to which such termination is made.  If validly terminated pursuant to </font><u><font size=2>Section&nbsp;4.1</font></u><font size=2>, this Agreement shall become wholly void and of no further force and effect without liability to the Purchaser, the Seller, the Project Company or any of its or their respective Subsidiaries, Affiliates, officers, directors, employees, agents, advisors or other representatives, and each shall be fully released and discharged from any
liability or obligation under or resulting from this Agreement, and neither the Seller nor the Purchaser shall have any other remedy or cause of action under or relating to this Agreement or any Applicable Law, including, without limitation, for reimbursement of expenses, except that the obligations of the Seller and the Purchaser under the Confidentiality Agreement and the obligations of the parties under this </font><u><font size=2>Section 4.2</font></u><font size=2> and </font><u><font size=2>Sections 7.5</font></u><font size=2>, </font><u><font size=2>7.6</font></u><font size=2> and </font><u><font size=2>7.18</font></u><font size=2> and </font><u><font size=2>Articles X</font></u><font size=2> and </font><u><font SIZE=2>XI</font></u><font size=2> of this Agreement shall remain in full force and effect; </font><u><font size=2>provided</font></u><font size=2>, </font><u><font size=2>however</font></u><font size=2>, that nothing in this </font><u><font size=2>Section
4.2</font></u><font size=2> shall be deemed to release any party from liability for any fraud or willful breach of its obligations under this Agreement in any material respect.</font></p>

<p STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;'><B><FONT SIZE=2>ARTICLE V</FONT></B></P>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;'><B><FONT SIZE=2><A NAME="TOC21"></A>REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES OF THE SELLER</FONT></B></P>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>As of the Effective Date and again on the Closing Date, the Seller hereby represents and warrants to the Purchaser as follows:</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="283" style='margin-left:1.0in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2><a name="toc22"></a>5.1</font></p> </td>
        <td width="235" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Organization and Good Standing</font></u><font size=2>.</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Seller is a limited liability company duly organized, validly existing and in good standing under the laws of the jurisdiction in which it is formed and has the requisite power and authority to own, lease and operate its properties and to carry on its business as it is now being conducted.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Project Company is a limited liability company duly organized, validly existing and in good standing under the laws of the jurisdiction in which it is formed and has the requisite power and authority to own, lease and operate its properties and to carry on its business as it is now being conducted.  The Project </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="36" style='margin-left:210.0pt;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="36" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>21</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<pAGE>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Company has no subsidiaries and does not own any shares of capital stock or other securities of another Person.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Seller has delivered to the Purchaser complete and accurate copies of the Governing Documents of the Project Company.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2><a name="toc23"></a>5.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Authorization; Enforceability</font></u><font size=2>.  The Seller has the requisite power and authority to execute and deliver this Agreement and to consummate the transactions contemplated hereby.  The execution and delivery of this Agreement by the Seller and the consummation by the Seller of the transactions contemplated by this Agreement have been duly authorized by all necessary action on the part of the Seller and its Affiliates.  This Agreement has been duly executed and delivered by the Seller and, assuming the due execution and delivery by the Purchaser, constitutes a legal, valid and binding obligation of the Seller, enforceable against the Seller in accordance with its terms.</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="221" style='margin-left:1.0in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2><a name="toc24"></a>5.3</font></p> </td>
        <td width="173" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>No Violation; Consents</font></u><font size=2>.</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as set forth on </font><u><font size=2>Section 5.3(a)</font></u><font size=2> of the </font><u><font size=2>Seller&#146;s Disclosure Schedule</font></u><font size=2>, and subject to obtaining the Seller Approvals set forth on </font><u><font size=2>Section 5.3(b)</font></u><font size=2> of the </font><u><font size=2>Seller&#146;s Disclosure Schedule</font></u><font size=2>, the execution and delivery by the Seller of this Agreement and the consummation by the Seller of the transactions contemplated hereby do not and will not:</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;violate, contravene, conflict with or result in the breach of any provision of the Governing Documents of, or resolutions of the boards of directors of, the Seller or the Project Company,</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;violate, contravene, conflict with, result in the breach of or give rise to any right to revoke, withdraw, suspend, modify or terminate any Approval or Consent to which the Seller or the Project Company or any Asset is bound or subject,</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(iii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;violate, contravene, conflict with or result in the breach of any Applicable Law,</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(iv)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;except for Permitted Encumbrances, result in the imposition or creation of any Encumbrance upon the Membership Interest or</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(v)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;permit any Person the right to declare a default or exercise any remedy under, to accelerate the maturity, performance or payment of or to cancel, terminate or modify any note, bond, mortgage, indenture, license or agreement.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Clauses (ii), (iii), (iv) and (v) shall not apply to any conflict, violation, breach, default, requirement for Consents, rights of acceleration, cancellation, termination or Encumbrance that would not reasonably be expected to have, individually or in the aggregate, a Seller Material Adverse Effect or a Project Company Material Adverse Effect.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except for such Seller Approvals set forth on </font><u><font size=2>Section 5.3(b)</font></u><font size=2> of the </font><u><font size=2>Seller&#146;s Disclosure Schedule</font></u><font size=2>, no Approval or Consent issued by, or declaration or filing with, or notification to, or waiver from any Person, is required on the part of the Seller in connection with the execution and delivery of this Agreement, or the performance by the Seller of any provision contained in this Agreement, except for any such requirements the failure of which to obtain or make would not reasonably be expected to have, individually or in the aggregate, a Seller Material Adverse Effect or a Project Company Material Adverse Effect.</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="133" style='margin-left:1.0in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2><a name="toc25"></a>5.4</font></p> </td>
        <td width="85" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Litigation</font></u><font size=2>.</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as set forth in </font><u><font size=2>Section 5.4(a)</font></u><font size=2> of the </font><u><font size=2>Seller&#146;s Disclosure Schedule</font></u><font size=2>, no Action or Order is pending or, to the Seller&#146;s Knowledge, threatened against the Seller, the Project Company or its business, any Asset or any of the Seller&#146;s Affiliates that seeks to restrain or prohibit or otherwise challenge the consummation, legality or validity of this Agreement or the transactions contemplated hereby.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as set forth in </font><u><font size=2>Section 5.4(b)</font></u><font size=2> of the </font><u><font size=2>Seller&#146;s Disclosure Schedule</font></u><font size=2>, none of the Seller, the Project Company or its business or any Asset (i) is subject to any outstanding Order or (ii) is a party or, to the Seller&#146;s Knowledge, is contemplated or threatened to be made a party to any action, suit, proceeding, hearing or investigation of, in, or before any court or quasi judicial or administrative agency of any federal, state, local or foreign jurisdiction or before any arbitrator that would reasonably be expected to have, individually or in the aggregate a Seller Material Adverse Effect or Project Company Material Adverse Effect.</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="213" style='margin-left:1.0in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2><a name="toc26"></a>5.5</font></p> </td>
        <td width="165" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Compliance with Law</font></u><font size=2>.</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Applicable Law</font></u><font size=2>.  The Seller and the Project Company have complied in all material respects with all Necessary Approvals and all Applicable Laws other than Environmental, Health and Safety Laws, which are the subject of </font><u><font size=2>Section 5.6</font></u><font size=2>.  Except as set forth in </font><u><font size=2>Section 5.5(a)</font></u><font size=2> of the </font><u><font size=2>Seller&#146;s Disclosure Schedule</font></u><font size=2>, the Seller has not received notification that it has violated any Necessary Approval or any Applicable Law other than Environmental, Health and Safety Laws, which are the subject of </font><u><font size=2>Section 5.6</font></u><font size=2>.</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="207" style='margin-left:1.0in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>(b)</font></p> </td>
        <td width="159" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Necessary Approvals</font></u><font size=2>.</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as set forth on </font><u><font size=2>Part A</font></u><font size=2> of </font><u><font size=2>Section 5.5(b)(i)</font></u><font size=2> of the </font><u><font size=2>Seller&#146;s Disclosure Schedule</font></u><font size=2>, the Project Company holds all Approvals, including occupancy permits, that are required to be obtained from a Governmental Authority under Applicable Laws other than Environmental, Health and Safety Laws, which are the subject of </font><u><font size=2>Section 5.6</font></u><font size=2>, in connection with the use, operation or ownership of the Project and the conduct of the Project Company&#146;s business as currently conducted (&#147;</font><u><font size=2>Necessary Approvals</font></u><font size=2>&#148;).  All Necessary Approvals are listed in </font><u><font size=2>Part B</font></u><font size=2> of </font><u><font
size=2>Section 5.5(b)(i)</font></u><font size=2> of the </font><u><font size=2>Seller&#146;s Disclosure Schedule</font></u><font size=2>.  Any application for the renewal of any such Necessary </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="36" style='margin-left:210.0pt;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="36" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>23</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<pAGE>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Approval due prior to the Closing Date has been, or will be, timely filed prior to the Closing Date.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as set forth in </font><u><font size=2>Section 5.5(b)(ii)</font></u><font size=2> of the </font><u><font size=2>Seller&#146;s Disclosure Schedule</font></u><font size=2>, all Necessary Approvals are in full force and effect, and no proceeding to modify, suspend, revoke, withdraw, terminate or otherwise limit any Necessary Approval is pending or, to the Knowledge of the Seller, threatened.  No administrative or governmental action has been taken or, to the Knowledge of the Seller, threatened in connection with the expiration, continuance or renewal of any Necessary Approval.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(iii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as noted in </font><u><font size=2>Section 5.5(b)(iii)</font></u><font size=2> of the </font><u><font size=2>Seller&#146;s Disclosure Schedule</font></u><font size=2>, the sale of the Membership Interest contemplated herein will not cause any Necessary Approval material to the continuing operation of the Project to become invalid or subject to reissuance or modification.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2><a name="toc27"></a>5.6&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Environmental Matters</font></u><font size=2>.  Except as set forth in </font><u><font size=2>Section 5.6</font></u><font size=2> of the </font><u><font size=2>Seller&#146;s Disclosure Schedule</font></u><font size=2>:</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Project Company is and has been at all times and in all material respects in compliance with all applicable Environmental, Health and Safety Laws, which compliance includes, but is not limited to, the possession of all Approvals required under applicable Environmental, Health and Safety Laws to own and operate the Project, and compliance with the terms and conditions thereof;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;all material Approvals currently held by the Project Company pursuant to the Environmental, Health and Safety Laws are identified in </font><u><font size=2>Section 5.6(b)</font></u><font size=2> of the </font><u><font size=2>Seller&#146;s Disclosure Schedule</font></u><font size=2>;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Project Company has not received any communication that alleges that the Project Company is not in compliance with all applicable Environmental, Health and Safety Laws;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;no Environmental Claim is pending or, to the Seller&#146;s Knowledge, threatened against the Project Company; </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to the Knowledge of the Seller, there are no past or present actions, activities, circumstances, conditions, events or incidents, including, without limitation, the release, emission, discharge, presence or disposal of any Material of Environmental Concern that could reasonably be expected to form the basis of any material Environmental Claim against the Project Company; </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;neither the Seller nor the Project Company has entered into, and the Facility is not subject to, any Action, Order, judgment, suit, proceeding, decree, agreement, injunction or, to the Knowledge of the Seller, any material investigation or inquiry, of any Governmental Authority relating to Liabilities under any Environmental, Health and Safety Laws, other than matters that have been resolved in a final and binding </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="36" style='margin-left:210.0pt;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="36" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>24</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>proceeding and for which neither the Project Company nor the Facility has any further Liability; and</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(g)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to Seller&#146;s Knowledge neither Seller nor the Project Company has received from any Governmental Authority, notification of a material requirement to take action to comply with any applicable Environmental, Health and Safety Laws (including Approvals required thereunder) with respect to the Project, and which action has not yet been completed.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2><a name="toc28"></a>5.7&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Ownership</font></u><font size=2>.  The Seller is, and on the Closing Date will be, the sole record and beneficial owner of the Membership Interest, free and clear of all Encumbrances other than those created by this Agreement and requirements under Applicable Law.  The Seller does not own any securities issued by, or other obligations of, the Project Company other than the Membership Interest, and other than by virtue of its sole ownership of the Membership Interest, the Seller does not own any of the Assets.  Such Membership Interest has been duly authorized and validly issued, is fully paid and, except as may be expressly set forth in the Governing Documents, has no requirements for the owner thereof to make additional contributions to, or be liable for, the obligations of the Project Company.  Other than pursuant
to this Agreement there are not, and at the Closing there will not be, any existing options, warrants, calls, rights of preemption, subscriptions or other rights or other agreements or commitments of any character to acquire any membership interests of the Project Company, or securities convertible into or exchangeable for or which otherwise confer on the holder thereof any right to acquire any interest in the Project Company, nor is the Project Company committed to issue, sell or otherwise cause to become outstanding any such option, warrant, right or security.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2><a name="toc29"></a>5.8&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Title to Assets</font></u><font size=2>.  The Project Company has good, valid and marketable title to all the Assets that it purports to own free and clear of all Encumbrances (except for Permitted Encumbrances and except for properties and assets disposed of in the Ordinary Course of Business since the date of the Financial Statements) including all the Assets reflected in the Financial Statements and all Assets purchased by the Project Company since the Most Recent Fiscal Year End, which subsequently acquired personal properties and assets (other than inventory and short term investments) are listed in </font><u><font size=2>Section 5.8</font></u><font size=2> of the </font><u><font size=2>Seller&#146;s Disclosure Schedule</font></u><font size=2>; provided that the Project shall only be subject to Permitted Real
Estate Encumbrances.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2><a name="toc30"></a>5.9&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Description of Real Property</font></u><font size=2>.  </font><u><font size=2>Section 5.9</font></u><font size=2> of the </font><u><font size=2>Seller&#146;s Disclosure Schedule</font></u><font size=2> contains a correct legal description of the Real Property.  The Project constitutes all real property currently owned by the Project Company.  Ownership of the Project is sufficient for the Project Company to conduct its business in the Ordinary Course of Business.  Neither the Seller nor the Project Company has received notice of the institution or proposed institution of any condemnation proceedings in respect of any of the Real Property.  Except as set forth in </font><u><font size=2>Section 1.1(C)</font></u><font size=2> of the </font><u><font size=2>Seller&#146;s Disclosure Schedule</font></u><font size=2> and in
the last sentence of this </font><u><font size=2>Section 5.9</font></u><font size=2>, the Project Company is not a party to any lease, sublease, license or occupancy agreement of or with respect to the Project or any other real property, nor is the Project subject to any lease, sublease, license or occupancy agreement.  A true and complete copy of each of the following </font></p>

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2><a name="toc31"></a>5.10</font></p> </td>
        <td width="167" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Condition of Facilities</font></u><font size=2>.</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other than as part of routine or planned maintenance in the Ordinary Course of Business, no material item of Tangible Personal Property or any portion of the Improvements is in need of major repair or replacement.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as set forth in </font><u><font size=2>Section 5.10(b)</font></u><font size=2> of the </font><u><font size=2>Seller&#146;s Disclosure Schedule</font></u><font size=2>, there are no pending material claims for defective work, equipment or materials relating to the Facility made by the Project Company or the Seller against any Person.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;To Seller&#146;s Knowledge, (i) use of the Real Property for the various purposes for which it is presently being used is permitted as of right under all applicable zoning Laws, and (ii) all Improvements are in compliance with all Applicable Laws, including those pertaining to zoning, building and the disabled.  The Seller has not received notice, written or otherwise, to the effect that there is an existing or proposed plan to modify or realign any street or highway or any existing or proposed eminent domain proceeding that would result in the taking of all or any part of the Facility or that would prevent or hinder the continued use of the Facility as heretofore used in the conduct of the business of the Project Company.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Seller has delivered to the Purchaser the most current &#147;as-built&#148; drawings of the Facility in the possession or control of the Project Company or the Seller.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2><a name="toc32"></a>5.11&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Financial Advisors</font></u><font size=2>.  The Purchaser is not and will not become obligated to pay any fee or commission or like payment to any broker, finder or financial advisor as a result of the consummation of the transactions contemplated by this Agreement based upon any arrangement made by or on behalf of the Project Company, the Seller or any Affiliates of the Seller.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2><a name="toc33"></a>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

    <tr >
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>5.12</font></p> </td>
        <td width="225" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Employees; Employee Benefits</font></u><font size=2>.</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Project Company does not have, and on the Closing Date will not have, any employees.  The Project Company has no liabilities or obligations with respect to any Employees or any other individuals (including, but not limited to, contract workers, lease employees or temporary employees) that have performed work at or in connection with the Facility or in connection with the business of the Project Company.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Project Company does not sponsor and has not in the past sponsored any Employee Plans.  The Project Company has no liability or obligation with respect to any Employee Plans of any ERISA Affiliate.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as set forth on </font><u><font size=2>Section 5.12(c)</font></u><font size=2> of the </font><u><font size=2>Seller&#146;s Disclosure Schedule</font></u><font size=2>, no Employee is covered by an employment agreement or any other contractual obligation to continue employment with either the Seller or any Affiliate of the Seller.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;None of the Project Company, the Seller or any Affiliate of the Seller has made any commitments or representations to any Person regarding (i) employment by the Purchaser at the Facility after the Closing Date, (ii) any benefits to be provided by the Purchaser or Affiliates of the Purchaser after the Closing Date, or (iii) any other terms and conditions of employment by the Purchaser following the Closing Date.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;With respect to the Employees, the Project Company, the Seller and all Affiliates of the Seller are in compliance with the Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification Act (the &#147;WARN Act&#148;), if applicable, and the Project Company, the Seller or Affiliates of the Seller have provided all affected Employees with all notices, if any, required under the WARN Act within the time periods required by the WARN Act.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as set forth in </font><u><font size=2>Section 5.12(f)</font></u><font size=2> of the </font><u><font size=2>Seller&#146;s Disclosure Schedule</font></u><font size=2>, the Project Company, the Seller and all Affiliates of the Seller have complied in all material respects with all Applicable Laws relating to the employment of the Employees, including terms and conditions of employment, equal employment opportunity, nondiscrimination, immigration, wages, hours, benefits and other employment practices, the payment of social security and similar Taxes and occupational safety and health.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2><a name="toc34"></a>5.13&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Labor Matters</font></u><font size=2>.  None of the Seller, the Project Company or any of their Affiliates is a party to or bound by any collective bargaining or similar agreement with any labor organization relating to the Employees, all of whom are employees of Progress Ventures and not of the Project Company, and the Seller has no Knowledge of (a) any current or planned employee union or organizing activities relating to the Employees, (b) any union claiming to represent any of the Employees, and (c) any current or threatened strike, dispute, slowdown, stoppage or lockout actually pending relating to the Employees.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2><a name="toc35"></a>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="36" style='margin-left:210.0pt;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="36" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>27</font></p> </td> </tr></table>
